Pre-Game Insights: The Flames will be looking to maintain their perfect start in the qualifiers and utilise home advantage against Tunisia, a side full of class and quality.
The Flames should look beyond the Carthage Eagles’ status and avoid being intimidated by their previous achievements.
Patrick Mabedi said his troops would not be intimidated by previous records.
He will likely ring some changes to the team that started against Liberia in today’s match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The two teams are separated by 91 places on the Fifa rankings, with the Flames on 123 whereas Carthage Eagles are on position 32 in the world.
Malawi and Tunisia have met seven times since 1987.
The most recent matches between the two teams ended in stalemates.
Others: Tunisia arrived in Malawi on Sunday on a chartered plane.
The Flames are third with three points, behind Tunisia on goal difference who defeated Sao Tome and Principe 4-0.
